title: Great Mosque of Djenné
subtle:
Informational (nonfiction), 523 words, Level N (Grade 2), Lexile 680L            
                        
		Multilevel Book also available in levels                     W and Z1
description: The Great Mosque of Djenné is the largest mud-brick building in the world. It is in Mali, in West Africa, and its history dates back centuries. The mosque has been completely rebuilt three times over the years. Students learn about the history of this amazing structure, as well as the early spread of Islam in the area.
